references.reason: This paper describes the GPT-4 model, which is one of the foundational large language models used in the experiments.
This paper demonstrates the few-shot learning capabilities of large language models, which is critical for retrieval-augmented generation.

references.paper_title: Dense passage retrieval for open-domain QA
references.reason: This paper introduces dense passage retrieval (DPR), a key technique for retrieving relevant information in open-domain question answering, a core component of RAG systems.

references.paper_title: Retrieval-augmented generation for knowledge-intensive nlp tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces the retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) framework itself, making it essential for any work building upon or improving RAG.

references.paper_title: triviaqa: A Large Scale Distantly Supervised Challenge Dataset for Reading Comprehension
references.reason: The TriviaQA dataset represents an important benchmark used for evaluating the proposed model, so any paper featuring this dataset would be important.
